name: Hanging Leg Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Find a sturdy pull-up bar or similar apparatus to hang from.

2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
3. Lift your legs straight up off the ground, keeping them straight and together throughout the movement.
4. Slowly raise your legs up against gravity without swinging or moving the rest of your body, aiming to keep your legs as still as possible.
5. Hold your legs raised at the top for a brief moment before slowly lowering them back down.
6. Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Hanging leg raises are an effective exercise that targets the rectus abdominis and other core muscles, improving strength and endurance in the upper abs and overall core stability.
